diseases.name: Common Cold
diseases.causes: Viral infection spread through airborne droplets or contact with infected surfaces.
home_remedies: Ensure plenty of rest and sleep
Keep child well-hydrated with water, warm soups, and juices
Use saline nasal drops to relieve congestion
Honey (for children over 1 year) to soothe cough
Use a cool-mist humidifier in the room
Warm salt water gargle for older children
diseases.when_to_see_doctor: If fever exceeds 102¬∞F (39¬∞C), symptoms last more than 10 days, or child has difficulty breathing.

diseases.name: Ear Infection
symptoms: Ear pain or tugging at ear
diseases.causes: Bacterial or viral infection in the middle ear, often following a cold.
home_remedies: Apply warm compress to the affected ear
Keep child's head elevated during sleep
Give age-appropriate pain relievers
Ensure adequate hydration
Encourage swallowing to help drain the ear
diseases.when_to_see_doctor: If symptoms don't improve within 2-3 days, child has high fever, or there's discharge from the ear.

diseases.name: Chickenpox (Varicella)
diseases.causes: Varicella-zoster virus, highly contagious through direct contact or airborne transmission.
home_remedies: Calamine lotion to reduce itching
Cool baths with baking soda or oatmeal
Keep fingernails trimmed to prevent scratching
Dress child in loose, comfortable clothing
Use antihistamines for severe itching
Ensure plenty of rest and fluids
diseases.when_to_see_doctor: If rash spreads to eyes, high fever persists, or blisters become infected.

diseases.name: Hand, Foot & Mouth Disease
diseases.causes: Coxsackievirus, spread through contact with infected fluids or feces.
home_remedies: Offer cold foods like ice pops to soothe mouth sores
Avoid acidic or spicy foods
Ensure adequate fluid intake
Use pain relievers for fever
Rinse mouth with warm salt water
Apply soothing balm to skin rashes
diseases.when_to_see_doctor: If child cannot drink fluids, symptoms worsen, or fever is very high.
prevention: Teach children not to share utensils

diseases.name: Gastroenteritis (Stomach Flu)
diseases.causes: Viral or bacterial infection affecting the digestive system.
home_remedies: Oral rehydration solutions (like Pedialyte)
Small, frequent sips of clear fluids
BRAT diet (Bananas, Rice, Applesauce, Toast)
Plenty of rest
Avoid dairy and fatty foods temporarily
Keep child away from others to prevent spread
diseases.when_to_see_doctor: If signs of dehydration appear, vomiting persists beyond 24 hours, or bloody stools are present.

diseases.name: Measles
symptoms: Rash starting on face and spreading down body
diseases.causes: Highly contagious viral infection spread through airborne droplets.
home_remedies: Ensure complete bed rest
High-dose vitamin A supplementation (consult doctor)
Maintain adequate hydration
Use cool-mist humidifier to ease cough
Keep room darkened to ease eye irritation
Dress in comfortable, breathable clothing
diseases.when_to_see_doctor: Seek immediate medical attention if suspected, as measles requires professional monitoring.

diseases.name: Strep Throat
diseases.causes: Group A Streptococcus bacteria spread through droplets from coughing or sneezing.
home_remedies: Warm salt water gargles several times daily
Cold throat lozenges or popsicles for pain relief
Honey to soothe throat irritation
Anti-inflammatory medications like ibuprofen
Adequate hydration with warm drinks
Complete rest until fever subsides
diseases.when_to_see_doctor: Consult doctor for antibiotics, which are essential to prevent complications like rheumatic fever.
prevention: Teach child not to share utensils or drinks
Keep infected child away from others

diseases.name: Pink Eye (Conjunctivitis)
diseases.causes: Bacterial, viral, or allergic infection/irritation of the eye membrane.
home_remedies: Wash hands frequently before touching eyes
Use warm compresses on closed eyes
Gently clean away discharge with warm water
Apply artificial tears if irritated
Avoid touching or rubbing eyes
Use clean towels and pillowcases frequently
diseases.when_to_see_doctor: If discharge is thick/yellowish (bacterial), eyes become painful, or vision is affected.
prevention: Don't share eye makeup or contacts
Avoid rubbing eyes with dirty hands

diseases.name: Croup
symptoms: Mild symptoms during day, worse at night
diseases.causes: Viral infection, usually parainfluenza virus, causing inflammation in the airways.
home_remedies: Cool mist or steam inhalation for 15-20 minutes
Keep child calm and relaxed
Elevate head with extra pillows
Use humidifier in bedroom overnight
Offer honey and warm drinks (for children over 1 year)
Avoid smoke and irritants
diseases.when_to_see_doctor: If stridor is present during rest, severe difficulty breathing, drooling, or symptoms worsen.

diseases.name: Whooping Cough (Pertussis)
symptoms: Severe coughing fits followed by 'whooping' sound
diseases.causes: Bordetella pertussis bacteria, highly contagious respiratory infection.
home_remedies: Ensure child gets complete rest
Maintain high fluid intake
Use humidifier to ease congestion
Smaller, frequent meals to prevent vomiting
Keep environment calm and quiet
Monitor for complications like pneumonia
diseases.when_to_see_doctor: Medical attention essential; antibiotics may be prescribed. Hospitalization may be needed for severe cases.
prevention: Booster shots for older children and adults

diseases.name: Atopic Dermatitis (Eczema)
symptoms: Small raised bumps that leak fluid when scratched
diseases.causes: Genetic predisposition combined with environmental triggers and impaired skin barrier function.
home_remedies: Use fragrance-free, gentle moisturizers immediately after bathing
Lukewarm (not hot) baths with mild cleansers
Apply hydrocortisone cream for itching (under medical guidance)
Use humidifier to maintain skin moisture
Avoid harsh detergents and fabrics
Keep fingernails trimmed to prevent damage from scratching
diseases.when_to_see_doctor: If rash spreads, signs of infection appear, or over-the-counter treatments don't help.

diseases.name: Mumps
diseases.causes: Mumps virus spread through droplets from coughing or sneezing; highly contagious.
home_remedies: Complete bed rest during acute phase
Soft foods like mashed potatoes, yogurt, pudding
Pain relievers for aches and fever
Warm compresses on swollen glands
Encourage fluid intake
Avoid acidic foods and drinks that irritate glands
diseases.when_to_see_doctor: For confirmation, monitoring, and watching for complications like meningitis or hearing loss.
